intro: Centaurea splendens f. brunnea, commonly known as the brown-centred gladiola, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its striking, bright red to orange flowers with a distinctive brown center, which sets it apart from other centaurea varieties. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. This cultivar is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
